definition: Shi Tao (1642-1707), Chinese landscape painter and poet
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
surname Shi
big wave/Taiwan pr. [tao2]

sentences.english: Shi led a wandering life for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 很長一段時間石濤都在過着浪跡天涯的生活。

sentences.english: Shi Tao that his painting not as the ancients did not like modern people.
sentences.chinese: 石濤認爲他的畫不象古人也不象今人。

definition: Huang Tingjian (1045-1105), Song poet and calligrapher
freehand drawing or painting in traditional Chinese style
Huang Binhong (1865-1955), art historian and literati painter
to trace over/to copy (a calligraphy model)/facsimile/(fig.) to depict/to portray
painting world/painting circles
Chang Dai-chien or Zhang Daqian (1899-1983), one of the greatest Chinese artists of the 20th century
gongbi, traditional Chinese painting method characterized by meticulous brush technique and detailed description
landscape painting
Gu Kaizhi or Ku K'aichih (346-407), famous painter of Eastern Jin dynasty, one of the Four Great Painters of the Six Dynasties 六朝四大家
vigor of strokes in calligraphy or drawing/vigor of style in literary composition
Yang Ningshi (873-954) calligrapher of 5 dynasties period between Tang and Song
short comments/preface and postscript
Liu Gongquan (778-865), Tang calligrapher
letter/also written 書札|书札
blue-and-green landscape (genre of landscape painting originating in the Tang dynasty, in which blues and greens predominate)
variant of 模擬|模拟[mo2 ni3]
